page.title: 14SAINT BARNABAS CHURCH
page.content: Saint Barnabas Church at Velindre is dedicated to Saint Barnabas.The church is in the middle of the village and next to our school. Barnabas preached about Jesus and went to Antioch to help the Christians who were persecuted there. His name means "son of encouragement". The festival of Saint Barnabas is celebrated on June 12th each year and we always have special sevices on the Sunday before this date.The church was given to the people of Velindre by Lord Cawdor and it was built in 1862. It has many coloured windows and a pipe organ.On the walls there is a plaque commemorating the men who were killed during the First World War. There is also a plaque in memory of a soldier who was killed in the Boer War.Near the entrance is a tile showing Lord Cawdor's Coat of Arms.
